messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] graciously accepting free help
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/19/02 11:28:52 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... I guess what I don t understand here is why people have to be rude to others trying to help.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/19/02 11:28:52 AM Pacific Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> OR you can politely and courteously accept the abundant and speedy FREE
> advice you can get here.
>

I guess what I don't understand here is why people have to be rude to others
trying to help. If you don't agree fine great but no need to get rude. I
have gotten some wonderful information on this list and some that I chose not
to use, it is my choice, but I hope I have never come across as rude to any
one.

Take what you will and leave what you don't but always be polite. You can
state you thoughts without hurting others.

Heidi


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: graciously accepting free help
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/19/02 12:18:15 PM, dacunefare@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/19/02 12:18:15 PM, dacunefare@... writes:

<< It's been a long long time since I let a stranger hurt my feelings with a
response on an email list. :::sigh::: Time to go no mail and deal with the
stress. "See" you all later. >>

Now the person who made Deborah Cunefare grouchy enough to leave this list
has done a very bad thing, because Deborah has YEARS and years of good
experience.

SO...

**She goes. Why would being unschooled all her life be a problem?**
**I never said it was a problem! That's YOUR interpretation.

The person who was tacky in that way will have LESS good input now, and so
will everyone else who comes here for a while.

That's a damned shame.

You can pay for someone to help you with unschooling.
here are two places you can do so:
http://www.holtgws.com/consult.htm
http://www.naturalchild.org/home/ (click "counseling")

OR you can politely and courteously accept the abundant and speedy FREE
advice you can get here.

You also certainly have the option to be tacky and offend people who
volunteer to help you, but that's not your best choice.

Sandra
